newsitem.title: USA: Duquesne to fully restore Pa. nuke Thursday.
newsitem.headline: Duquesne to fully restore Pa. nuke Thursday.

text.p: Duquesne Light Co said Tuesday it would fully restore its 833 megawatt (MW) Beaver Valley 2 nuclear generating unit Thursday following a refueling and maintenance outage that began August 30.
"We expected to be on line late tomorrow, and be at full power December 5," said a company spokesman.
The adjacent Beaver Valley 1 (810 MW) was operating at full output.
DQE Inc, Duquesne's parent company, owns 47.5 percent of Beaver Valley 1. The remaining 52.5 percent is owned by Ohio Edison Co.
DQE holds 13.7 percent stake in Beaver Valley 2, Ohio Edison (41.9 percent) and Centerior Energy (44.4 percent).
Duquesne operates both Shippingport, Pa. nuclear units.
